result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn J Lemieux II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 14-CF-115.  Probation agent to contact the Court five or six months after defendant is out of jail to set a probation review hearing.

miscConds.notes:
$100 fine plus costs on Ct. 1.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
9/03/15 - $472 U.S. currency held in evidence released and applied to fine/costs owing.
To pay restitution as part of case 13-CM-274, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on Cts. 3, 4 & 6.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. This to including AODA assessment and parent education counseling.

timeConds.notes: To perform 100 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

superMiscConds.notes: Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with anyone involved with illegal drug possession, use or sales.

$100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. See attached assessment report.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to all counts.

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
VC canceled as ADA Korb indicated matter will be resolved on 11/29/16. Their office will prepare transport order. VC canceled with Dodge.
Dodge Correctional does not have 9:45 available on 11/29/16 for VC, hearing moved to 10:15 that same day.  LS
from ADA Korb requesting video appearance for 11/29/16 hearing unless an agreement can be reached. Court approves video appearance.

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Schaefer would like time to review discovery in new file with defendant and discuss a global resolution to all matters with ADA Korb. Atty Schaefer to let court know if matter is resolved at next hearing so Court can prepare for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.
DC Restitution Summary
DC Sheriff Dept. final property disposition. $472 deposited with the Clerk of Court to be applied to fine/costs owing on this case.
for Return of Property.  It is ordered that the black wallet, Samsung cell phone and Apple iPhone can be returned to defendant. $472 in currency shall be applied to fine/costs owing in this case.

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews motion from defendant for return of property. Atty Schaefer indicates case has been concluded, feels items should now be returned to defendant. Atty Korb indicates co-defendants case is still pending, money in evidence is still in question as to whether it was used to buy/sell drugs. State has no objection to cellphones and wallet being returned. If money is released, would like it applied to fine/costs owing in this file. Court grants request, wallet and cellphones can be returned to defendant. Sheriff Dept. to turn currency over to the Clerk of Courts office to be applied to fine/costs owing in this file. Atty Schaefer will prepare order.
Door County Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests 72 hr furlough to visit his ill mother. Court denies request.

for Return of Property Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 968.20

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1, 3, 4 & 6. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 3, 4 & 6. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 5 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-26-2015 03:30 pm
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Atty Schaefer asks that hearing scheduled for 4/30/15 in 14-CF-115 be rescheduled to the same day as status in this file. Court reschedules hearing in 14-CF-115 to 6/08/15 at 9:15 am. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests prelim be set within 10 day time limit. Set for prelim. Bond remain in effect.
